io.smudgr.app.controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.smudgr.app.controller.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    Root singleton for controlling the application instance.

        Ideal count of update loops each beat.

        Defaults to 50

      • broadcastMessage

        public void broadcastMessage(ApiMessage message)
        Sends an ApiMessage to every client connected to the ApiServer. This also broadcasts the message to every ControllerExtension.

        This is used to synchronize outgoing API messages between all extensions. Do not use this method if an ApiMessage should only be received by a single ControllerExtension.

        Parameters:
        message - ApiMessage to send.
        See Also:
        getApiInvoker()

      • save

        public void save(PropertyMap pm)
        Save all loaded ControllerExtension states and AppControl states.
        Parameters:
        pm - The property map to save to.
        See Also:
        ProjectSaver

        Load any ControllerExtension states and AppControl states from the given PropertyMap
        Parameters:

      • getApiInvoker

        public ApiInvoker getApiInvoker()

        Returns:
        ApiInvoker
        See Also:

      • ticksToMs

        public int ticksToMs(int ticks)
        Convert a count of update loop cycles (ticks) to ideal real time milliseconds.

        This conversion is based on the ideal AppThread.getTarget() update count, so the accuracy of this method may change if Project.getBPM() changes during tick counting.

        However, even if the application is lagging, this estimate will continue to reflect the ideal milliseconds between updates. This is especially useful for getting the time between frames while recording.

        Parameters:
        ticks - The count of updates.
        Returns:
        The ideal milliseconds that would pass during ticks update loops.

      • getActualFPS

        public int getActualFPS()
        Gets the amount of frames rendered last second.
        Returns:
        amount of FPS last second

      • getTargetFPS

        public int getTargetFPS()
        Gets the target frames per second
        Returns:
        target FPS

      • getAppPath

        public java.lang.String getAppPath()
        Gets the current directory the application is running in.
        Returns:
        String

      • startOutput

        public void startOutput(FrameOutput output)
        Starts output using a given FrameOutput class.

        If the application isOutputting(), this method does nothing.

        Pauses the UpdateThread and delegates application updates to the RenderThread to ensure accurate in-time recording. Sets the target rendering FPS to the specified FrameOutput.getTargetFPS().

        Parameters:
        output - FrameOutput to use.
        See Also:
        stopOutput()

      • stopOutput

        public void stopOutput()
        Stops any currently outputting process.

        Resumes application updates using the UpdateThread and resets the target rendering FPS to TARGET_FPS

        See Also:
        startOutput(FrameOutput)

      • isOutputting

        public boolean isOutputting()
        Gets whether the current application is recording to a FrameOutput
        Returns:
        true if currently recording, false if otherwise
        See Also:
        startOutput(FrameOutput), stopOutput()
